intro: Mallotus floribundus, commonly known as the red-flowered hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers, which are typically borne in clusters and bloom during the rainy season. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Mallotus floribundus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
